sentences.chinese: 自古受命帝王及繼體守文之君，非獨內德茂也，蓋亦有外戚之助焉。
sentences.literal: Since ancient times, emperors and kings who received heaven's mandate, as well as those who inherited the throne and preserved established institutions, relied not only on their own flourishing virtue, but also received help from their maternal relatives.

sentences.chinese: 夏之興也以涂山，而桀之放也以末喜。
sentences.literal: The Xia dynasty rose through Tushan, but Jie was banished because of Moyi.

sentences.chinese: 殷之興也以有娀，紂之殺也嬖妲己。
sentences.literal: The Yin dynasty rose through Youxiong, but Zhou was killed because of his doting on Daji.

sentences.chinese: 周之興也以姜原及大任，而幽王之禽也淫於褒姒。
sentences.literal: The Zhou dynasty rose through Jiangyuan and Tai Ren, but King You was captured because of his debauchery with Baosi.

sentences.chinese: 故易基乾坤，詩始關雎，書美釐降，春秋譏不親迎。
sentences.literal: Therefore, the Book of Changes is founded on Qian and Kun, the Book of Odes begins with Guan Ju, the Book of Documents praises proper honors, and the Spring and Autumn Annals criticizes those who do not personally welcome their brides.

sentences.chinese: 夫婦之際，人道之大倫也。
sentences.literal: The bond between husband and wife is the greatest principle of human relationships.
Of all ritual applications, marriage alone requires the greatest caution.

sentences.chinese: 夫樂調而四時和，陰陽之變，萬物之統也。
sentences.literal: When music is well tuned, the four seasons harmonize—this governs the transformations of yin and yang and orders all things.
People can broaden the Way, but can do nothing about fate.

sentences.chinese: 孔子罕稱命，蓋難言之也。
sentences.literal: Confucius rarely spoke of fate, for it is difficult to discuss.

sentences.chinese: 及孝惠帝崩，天下初定未久，繼嗣不明。
sentences.literal: When Emperor Xiaohui passed away, the realm had only recently been pacified, and the succession was unclear.
When Empress Gao passed away, she was buried alongside Gaozu in Changling.

sentences.chinese: 唯獨置孝惠皇后居北宮。
sentences.literal: Only Empress Xiaohui was left dwelling in the Northern Palace.

sentences.chinese: 迎立代王，是為孝文帝，奉漢宗廟。
sentences.literal: They welcomed and established the King of Dai as Emperor Xiaowen, who maintained the Han ancestral temples.

sentences.chinese: 及諸侯畔秦，魏豹立為魏王，而魏媼內其女於魏宮。
sentences.literal: When the feudal lords rebelled against Qin, Wei Bao established himself as King of Wei, and Wei Fu brought her daughter into the Wei palace.
